com.ragego.utils

Class StandardGameFormatIO

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ragego.utils.StandardGameFormatIO
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FormatIO

    public class StandardGameFormatIO
extends java.lang.Object
implements FormatIO
    This class read an SGF file. SGF is a standard format to store Game data and is mostly used for Go games.
    See Also:
    For more details about behavior of this class, SGF for Go details

      • readRaw

        public GameNode[] readRaw(java.io.File file)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: FormatIO
        Read raw data from a file. This functon is suitable to get a raw data from a file. The board snaps extracted are just representative of board at some given times.
        Specified by:
        readRaw in interface FormatIO
        Parameters:
        file - File to read
        Returns:
        An array of sucessing position during the game. Index 0 is the first state and last index is the last state.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If error occurs when action acts.

      • read

        public GameBoard read(java.io.File file,
                      GameBoard game)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: FormatIO
        Load a file in a Game. Load a game in an empty GameBoard. This load data about players, positions, stones. If the format could not store this data, it should create default data.
        Specified by:
        read in interface FormatIO
        Parameters:
        file - The file to load
        game - An empty GameBoard (previous data could be erased)
        Returns:
        true on success, false on all other state. In case of IOException, throw the error.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If error occurs when action acts.
